case.state: It's Blake. I'm here to get away from it all for a while.
Blake Belladonna. (This isn't any place on Remnant. Maybe I can let my guard down here... then again, maybe not.)
How could you possibly know that?... I mean, how could you know that for sure, if it was true.
Oh. Hey... team.
(Of course it is. I hope no one actually needs that warning.)
Oh hey. I wasn't expecting such a warm welcome. You can call me Blake.
Well, my outfit does just scream sunshine and roses, can't fault you.
Unique pickup line. I suppose I can't criticize it, you've got my attention at least. I'm Blake.
Ohh hey Yang! You're uhh... here to play as well then? (That's a stupid greeting of course she's here to play... with me)
That's a pretty poor impersonation. Who are you?
Neo? Cut it out. That's a terrible replica of my costume.
Right, it's April fools. (Impressive robotics at least. I bet Ruby would love to look them over.)
Pyrrha? You came along to a place like this? Then again I'm here too.
That's an impressive Semblance. Ruby briefly transforms, I think, but I've never seen something like that.
It's a bit of a strange choice to have me along if no one's interested, don't you think? I'll take the chance to relax and try something new, though.
Hmm, I wonder if, ~human~ prefers any hair colors, hard to tell. (And I hope that's not the only reason I'm at the table.)
Well I'm used to hanging out with other criminals. I just hope this is a better group of people than the last one.
I'm not too impressed, or out of my depth here actually. The Belladonna name is well known... if only where I grew up.
Not sure how much I'll have in common with you all, but I am a student too, at Beacon Academy.
Sorry if I seem a little out of place. This is quite a group.
I don't mind trailing behind the more outgoing ones on my team, or in a game like this.
(Oh, this game could be even more fun than I thought.)
This is the kind of table I was hoping for. Thank you for having me.
Uhh... okay. This is not the kind of group I expected to play with. Be prepared to give as good as you get. (Not going to deny enjoying reading about... something like this though.)
Might be for the best. I do like boys but too many could be overwhelming.
This does feel a little more comfortable for me... even in a game like this.
So you prefer a smaller crowd as well, ~player~. It does make it easier to settle in.
It's Blake. I'm here to get away from it all for a while.
I'll take, I mean, exchange ~cards.text~ ~cards.ifplural(cards|card)~.
~Cards.text~ ~cards.ifplural(cards|card)~.
Just ~cards.text~ ~cards.ifplural(cards|card)~, please.
Sure, ~cards.text~ ~cards.ifplural(cards|card)~, can't be any worse.
Sure, ~cards.text~ ~cards.ifplural(cards|card)~.
Hmm, ~cards.text~ ~cards.ifplural(cards|card)~.
~Cards.text~ ~cards.ifplural(cards|card)~ should set me up well for this round.
Should probably go for ~cards.text~ ~cards.ifplural(cards|card)~, thanks.
Hmm, maybe, ~cards.text~ ~cards.ifplural(cards|card)~, thanks.
~Cards.text~ ~cards.ifplural(cards|card)~, maybe? I'm a little more confident by now.
That time Ruby teased Weiss for being concerned for her romantic life, I was definitely surprised by the lean in from Ruby. They might actually make a cute couple.
Not sure if I want to have good luck at a time like this.
Sure. Can't frown at a rainbow... unless the rain keeps coming afterward.
Of course I'm going to get some good hands. Let's see if it keeps up.
Always better to start off with a few wins. I'll take hits eventually but at least I know I can fight back.
Doubt I need to worry about these cards and I've nearly finished this. I've got a few others lined up to read next I'd like to get to.
It would have been easy enough to bring a poker guide actually. Doesn't matter much anyway, it's not complex strategy to win a hand.
Can't say how often I'll play here, but it could grow on me.
Even I get some satisfaction out of petty victories. I'm not quite sure how Yang and Ruby get quite so much joy out of them, though.
(Games like this aren't something I've read about more than a few times... but that does make how this goes more interesting)
I bet Yang would've cracked a dozen puns about how handy these cards are by now.
I do enjoy the games my teammates play from time to time, even if the rules tend to be... far less coherent.
I was tempted to join the last Grimm and Grotto's session. I just wasn't sure how to bring it up with with Yang. I think I might before the next one.
I guess I don't mind being a few down in a friendly contest. I'm glad that's most of mine these days.
Even if I wasn't going to the next Vytal tournament I'd know it was coming up. Yang has had the time of her life making it clear how vital it is she trains for it.
I might still prefer a quiet night, a cup of tea and a book, but it's a closer contest than I expected.
I have slightly less cause to read at this point in the game, but I hate to leave a book without getting to the end of a section, or chapter.
When I was a bit younger I never thought I could be so comfortable away from home. I owe a lot to my team.
I don't like rain much, but it does sound nice, and watching Ruby and Weiss enjoy it is always sweet.
How secure I felt here was never about the cards, but this is a good hand too.
I enjoyed the Vytal festivals more than I expected. The unity between kingdoms is encouraging to see.
The Second Vytal festival is coming up. I'm not as keen on combat as Yang or Ruby, but fighting in the arena with the crowd roaring does get my blood pumping, and I'm too focused to be nervous.
I never thought I'd associate being comfortable and playing cards. Between my friends at Beacon and winning this hand, I guess I do now.
I won't deny that being admired is a nice change of pace.
One pleasant thing about growing up Faunus is sleeping. I'm pretty comfortable being awake, day or night. So ~background.time~ works great for me.
Closing my eyes in front of strangers... Either I've grown up or grown complacent, but I don't want to go back.
I actually just considered calling these cards "handy". I really have spent too much time around Yang.
I don't plan on bringing anyone home, not really my style to set out with it in mind... but plans can change, especially if the person trying to change them is charming enough.
I didn't attend a strip poker night to comfortably socialize, but it's certainly a welcome surprise.
It's nice to know I'm not going to lose this hand, but none of us came here to play cards.
I don't like having no control over how this round goes, but at least it's just cards.
Well, it was up to fate before I bothered.
I wasn't going to hope for a good hand anyway.
It was stupid to think that I could just hang out here and forget... everything.
I'm not pleased by this hand, but I can't deny that the game has taken my mind off my studies.
I never found the idea of fate as being neutral a very comforting one.
Victory is never a sure thing anyway.
It takes time to build investment... which I suppose is a benefit in this case. I don't care that much yet.
I do have a lot to be grateful for these days. I try not to lose sight of that.
I've been forced to let the cards fall where they may on bigger stuff, but it's never a great feeling.
I'm used to uncertainty at least, for whatever that is worth.
I might be fussing about the cards too much in spite of myself. This isn't so bad.
I've played plenty of board and card games since Beacon. I assumed I wouldn't have time, but if the rest of my team aren't studying anyway, I may as well join them, right?
It's interesting how certain we can be that things will be unpredictable.
My friends are always in such a rush to label what's happening, or label our odds. I'm content to just let this play out.
Well it's not life and death... for better or worse.
I wasn't expecting each hand to matter so much to me, but the stakes here are very different to a normal board game between friends, so I should have expected it.
It might seem minor, but not planning my days out ahead of time is very important to me. I didn't have that option for a long time.
You win some, you lose some, but not knowing what's happening is worse than either.
It took a while to adjust to the showers at Beacon with the water constantly hitting me like that, but they are much more pleasant by now.
I couldn't imagine myself at a game like this with well... non-faunus a few years ago. I'm glad that's changed. I'm glad I'm happy to... see this through.
You know what, if I can become friends with Weiss I can handle this game.
Ruby would probably be talking about how she definitely win with a hand like this. I'm not as sure, but I respect that attitude.
I've been told many times not to worry about what I can't control. Maybe it's finally sinking in.
I'm not much of a planner, but if you can keep a cool head in danger you've already got a big leg up on your enemies tactically.
I'm still going. Sometimes that's all you need.
I don't normally hurry to admit this, but I do hope the dog is doing alright. Yang would be pretty upset if anything happened to him.
I've got no problem winning through distraction. Stare away.
I'm often calm, but being at peace like this is far better.
It's not often I get the chance to do something this sexy, but I'm sure it won't be the last.
Maybe I have got a shot at this round after all.
No, I don't hate thunderstorms because I'm a cat Faunus. They're just so loud and sudden..
This isn't much of a surprise with my luck.
At least I'm not dealing with that dog. I cannot believe Yang's dad actually sent him to her and Ruby in the mail.
Great. Now all we need is a thunderstorm... which has nothing to do with... never mind.
Hopefully this hand isn't a sign of things to come, but I expect it is.
As Yang would say 'I can still win with this', mostly just before I beat her.
It's a shame that whenever people compete someone losing is a guarantee.
When I started playing cards with my team, I honestly thought I'd do well. The cards don't seem to care about stratagem or planning so much as dumb luck, it turns out.
Sure, why should my bad luck let up now, right?
My poker face is not the issue, the lack of anything to bet or bluff with might be.
Losing isn't new to me, losing in low stakes environments on the other hand...
I do keep wondering when my luck will turn bad again. I'm glad we're just playing cards... (and undressing.)
This won't win me anything. (Except admiration, maybe.)
Been in too much actual danger for a bad hand of cards to really worry me much.
I've gotten a lot further on trust than I ever thought I would, but I don't think that'll save this hand.
Somebody always loses. At least I signed up for it this time.
Wonderful cards. I know the hands don't matter, really, but I'm never pleased by my failure.
Shit.
I'm not certain how much nudity on its own would phase me in more casual contexts. This, on the other hand, is pretty intense, even for me.
I can't help but wonder if my downturns in luck will keep to the cards. It's been years, I know that, but last time I settled down too quickly...
At least when you're certain of the outcome it won't surprise you, even if it's bad.
For a moment, I was tempted to quote something dramatic, "do not go gentle into that good night", or similar, but it's just a hand of cards.
It's nice knowing your going to lose before it happens, as opposed to after you've committed.
I've heard it said we wouldn't know joy without pain, but I don't buy it. I was happy as a kid before anything went wrong.
I wonder at what point people decide they'd be okay with losing. I'm not going to throw but...
I can already hear Weiss telling me off for swapping that. Not that she would've have done much better.
Beacon's been good, this has been good... but it's hard to forget it all for long.
The lack of intense conflict for most of my life at Beacon is welcome, but sometimes...

I still remember all the mess before Beacon sometimes... it's been years now. I wonder if I should still be bothered by it all. Sorry, ignore me, I came out here to have fun and I shouldn't spoil that.
For all the shit we've been through, we're still here, and I smile more than I ever thought I would. I can handle one more bad hand of cards.
I did not come here to lose, but well... I knew my odds.
I'll trade any number of bad hands for feeling safe somewhere new, so thanks for that.
It really would not have been hard to just bring a book on poker. Though, the right gear isn't always enough to save you on it's own.
There is a time and a place for negativity, despite its dangers, but one more bad hand doesn't strike me as a good reason.
I keep wondering when exactly I let my guard down. I guess it's not something you can do on purpose.

I'm sorry, Noelle. I really admire your kindness, that's why I got too fired up with you. I'll think about it. You need to look at things a bit more... realistically, but don't lose that spark okay?... Like I did.
Not an interest prompted by a certain pretty funeral parlor head, right?
Like a Semblance, we have similar powers in my word... I think.
I feel like you should have warned us before you did that, but alright.
Right. And you've carefully considered the moral implications right? The destruction you'd bring?
I'm not about to throw a hand for you, but happy birthday.
We'll all have to redo our outfits anyway, whoever wins.
My Gambol shroud, it's a grappling hook, gun and sword. It's unique, but that's allowed me to become very good with it. Ada...a former frein... someone I used to know made it for me.
You know what I meant, Yang! Of course you're important to me!
That mostly depends on how bloody you're willing to get your hands. As a lone attacker you have the advantage of being hard to track, and surprise, but do you think it's fair to go that far?

I don't spend a lot of time thinking about it. Being comfortable and quiet with my friends is always good. Being able to nuzzle up and accept... cuddling, is good to. (And scritches, especially on my ears.)
I don't spend a lot of time thinking about that. Being comfortable and quiet with my friends is always wonderful. Nuzzling someone I trust and accepting ear scritches is deeply comforting to.
That's quite a title, what do you have to do to become the dreaded?
Gah. I've seen how rumors like that get spread to hurt people before. I trust you, Ignatz.
That sounds lovely, but I have to ask how many people have immediately talked about nudes when you announce it in a place like this?
If the test is tomorrow then I'm not sure what you can do except cram. I didn't pick you as the assassin type though, that's some very cold blooded violence.
Absolutely not. I've rarely enjoyed the attention I do get. I'm always impressed by your ability to easily handle so much spotlight.
Those who stick by you, even when you're not sure if you deserve it. How do you define friendship, Pyrrha? No pressure of course.
Lots, but mainly I don't take kindly to people making fun of Faunus. As I'm sure you can imagine.
I'm not sure what you're expecting me to say. We all need to blow off steam from time to time, right? Yang and Sun have made that very clear to me.
You know me well enough. Making plans before the day doesn't suit me. Probably more of the same though, study and training. Did you want to work together?
Depends what you're looking for, really. I mostly read romance, but I've read my share of horror and drama. I used to read a lot of adventure and fantasy.
You're so earnest it hurts, but that's still a compliment. Basically everyone you meet could be good, or could be a danger to the innocent. You can't assume goodwill, it needs to be seen, proved.

Exactly! I left the White Fang once I questioned Adam's actions, and lately I've actually been doing good. Bad people need you to trust them. They'll never fall in your lap, you have to be vigilant for them.
You're beautiful, Noelle. Weight doesn't change that at all.
Anything? Well, I uhh... appreciate you not covering up too much. I'll... think on it. (Because I can't say exactly what's on my mind, can I?)
I can't say no to that. I'm very glad to see that there is less trouble in your world with Faunus and non Faunus... And, Noelle, you may touch my ears later, if you want.
It is, my parents don't fit the deadly nightshade bill as well I do though. I take it your William Blake is pretty Gothic?

Sounds like he'd like Anima's 'death poems', which only the dying could write, as much as us. Like "Nothing in the cry of cicadas suggests they soon must die" and "August weeds? The only remains, of a warriors ambitions".

It is my real name, though it's worth noting belladonna nightshades are in the same family as potatoes. That might explain why I'm so different to my parents actually... What does William Blake write?

I find it a useful, almost gentle way to explore the subject, and a fascinating subject, to boot. To see so clearly where hundreds of minds have wandered in their final moments, and given us this insight.
Castles, huh? Certainly seems like that would still be interesting, if nothing else.
Certainly sounds like an interesting person. Introspecting on life is rarely a waste of time. I wonder what he'd have thought if he could meet Faunus, with an interest in humanity and nature.
Wait, when exactly did you realize you fell for me?
I'm sorry, that felt more mean than I intended. You're charming and pretty, Nanoko-chan, you don't need to doubt that so much.

My nightmares, huh? The trouble might be narrowing it down. Most of them center around my past going even worse. What if my friends had lost their life-or-death fights? What if my ex's blade had taken Yang's head instead..
For all the trouble they've caused me. I don't think I'd want to be without my... Well, I can understand how you feel, Arueshalae.
You know what... My ears, actually. Being a Faunus is trouble, I may cover them often, but for all that... I'd never want to part with them.
While my worst dreams are often near reality, so are my best. Happy time spent with my friends or my family, or... wandering beautiful, surreal landscapes.
A great mercenary would be the one who knows which contracts to take, and always gets the job done. Personally though, I'd hope you put more stock in being a good person.
Making plans before the day isn't really my style, as you've probably noticed. That said, I have always respected how consistent your work ethic is.
That's terrible! I prefer leaving my enemies with broken ribs. On my world that'd attract monsters as well, but I doubt that's an issue in yours.
Well... No. That said, there is nothing wrong with taking your time, not much to gain by rushing headlong into that stuff, trust me.
I certainly hope not. I've fought tooth and nail for my life too many times to die in my sleep.
It takes a fool to turn down free food, right? I'll let you buy me a drink too, if you like.
We get used to it, and we keep fit. Not all of us can afford or have the time to drive, so we make do with what we've got. A concept you don't seem to have a great grasp on.
Sure, I didn't really have a plan for after the game, so I can window shop for a bit.
Sure, happy to oblige whatever makes you more comfortable here, and not ask questions you don't feel like answering.
There are several answers to that phrasing, some of them might be true.
I haven't been a patron anywhere like this before. It's a good change of pace.
I'm not a big fan of water, but the ocean is beautiful, especially from here.
Well this certainly doesn't scream safety and comfort. At least if I decide to run I doubt anyone here could catch me.
Hmm, I could be convinced to go for a swim after the game... if anyone wanted to join me then.
This makes me nostalgic, I mostly grew up with hot springs. They'll be great to soak in after game.
Wouldn't be the first time I've spent a night in the forest, I doubt it'll be the last.
Who's bedroom is this exactly? I don't plan on getting in bed with anyone today. (Maybe I should rethink that though.)
At least the heat doesn't get to me much. I'm pretty used to these conditions.
I have near perfect sight in the dark, so ~background~ works great for me.
Not my choice of location to undress at, but the game might just... keep me hot enough.
Is this what a school is like where you come from? Beacon is a little more... dramatic.
Wouldn't be the first time I've undressed outside, even in a sexual context.
This is comforting actually. I'm very used to moving between and scouting from rooftops, and even other fighters tend to be much more clumsy and paranoid near drops.
Sure. I do appreciate that the showers at Beacon are open at any time you need them for when I'm... when missions run late sometimes.
Oh, Umm, yup... These cards might work. It's possible...
Is there any use in pretending I'm capable of tearing my eyes away from, ~mast~ for an extended period of time.
So, ~mast~, should I throw the game or not? I promise I'll listen well to any point your still capable of making.
Gothic sure is in at this table, huh? Not that I don't appreciate the compliments.
That is brave of you, Leon. It might just be a risk, just so you know.
Both of you may. It's often a good feeling for us, but as you can imagine, plenty of those who ask aren't worth giving the time of day because of how they ask. I do enjoy it.
It's not on me that you don't know how to wear the color. What's a confident blonde like you doing in black anyway?
Charming, truly. I don't make a lot of friends, but at least I have them.
I wasn't going for Gothic exactly, but I'll take the compliment from you.
Level enough to understand I'm not the best choice honestly. It went to Ruby, she's far brighter and more enthusiastic, but her zeal is contiguous. She pays enough attention to detail, if barely.
Interesting that you could spot that, but not that I wanted to hide it for a reason, Samus. If you're going to take issue with me, get to the fucking point.
Perhaps this makes it worse, but I am trying. I'm not used to being comfortable or safe in new places, not til I've adjusted at least.
Thanks, Mari. I appreciate your enthusiasm about it. I'm surprised you brought something so low key if you're that passionate about outfits.
I'm fully willing to see the game through if that's what you mean. Otherwise I'm... fine, I guess.

Well, keep both eyes open, Meia. The worst part is how long it took me to realize what the White Fang was doing was wrong. Pretty words and unity, on top of sense of righteous anger can let people ignore a lot.
I battle threats to the kingdoms, mainly Grimm---monsters, sometimes people. You seem quite excited about it, I find combat quite, ugly. Unless it's sparring or the arena, I suppose.

We have something similar, Aura and Semblances. Aura is basically armor you don't need to wear. Semblances are powers we are born with, mine is being able to leave a duplicate of myself behind while I move.
What have you got to be detached with your vision about? I doubt a god picked you out of pity. You certainly seem capable and kind to me.
I don't mind you talking. I'm almost a huntress, technically solo mercenaries but we often team up. We work closely with the kingdoms, they always need help keeping our borders safe from the Grimm.
I can definitely understand that. Fish is good! Sushi is good too... which has nothing to do with what I'm about to show, just so that's clear.
I can settle for being accepted here, at least for tonight, and with my friends, but I just wish it wasn't such a change of pace. I'm actually glad to hear my kin in other worlds are doing better.
I'm quite happy to be here now, thank you, Noelle. I know I'm running out of items too... so you don't have to be shy if you're... interested.
I would like that a lot... You don't have to touch just... only, there. If you want... of course.
Don't waste your breath on a 'we're better' speech. I've heard it all before, too many times.
No crimes these days, only legal violence, you?
You could tell I fight, huh? I'm a huntress, we fight monsters, mainly. Close range is the most efficient, but my sword is also a gun, and a grappling hook.
Don't tempt me. I can always brood more. I guess you deserve something for being such a gentleman though.
You don't need correcting then. I have free time but it just, never feels like the right moment.
I know. I could go for a whiskey or a tequila, if you're buying.
It's.. alright. I don't know a Faunus who doesn't enjoy it, actually. Getting permission depends entirely on who's asking, but... you can, yes.

It's a good question. The most advanced Atlas tech is automated drone soldiers who can independently pick out threats and use guns. Though they do tend to stand there like like idiots and let you close distance.
I wouldn't mind with you, I guess. But it's worth noting I know men who are kind and soft too. What do you want to know?
I can... certainly understand that. It would be nice to be able to just, let go , even for just a little while.
Remnant, in the Kingdom of Vale. I take it you hail from there?
Pleasantly surprised to hear that so early, go on?
Just as soon as there is something to see. Can you blame me for not wanting to just stand around?
I'm not as convinced yet, we can't all be so trusting. You might have a point though...
You know it's... it's healing along. It's doing fine... The cafeteria has sushi again!
You've asked me that once already, haven't you? <i> (What, oh shit, pull it together, this is happening... Why did I react like that?)
That's quite a question to open with, Monika. You might be right, but what gave you that impression?
Certainly sounds like it... I used to listen to a lot of angry metal and punk. It's still good music but it fueled... anyway, what's your take on the genre?
Not as unwise as sharing them too freely. Besides, I've made it this long, despite it all, so I don't think I'll be going to the grave anytime soon.
I suppose it depends on the scare, but I'd say so. Need someone to squash a spider for you, Tao?
Well that depends on one question, mainly. Am I climbing yours?
Thanks, Noire. I wasn't going to open with it, but your outfit is beautiful as well, suits you perfectly. The coloration shifts are thoughtful and they really sell it.
Thanks, I've got plenty more, if you wanted a few for yourself?

I train with a huntress team, yes. It's much, much easier than going alone, and I've become very fond of them. I wouldn't say I'm the strongest on the team, though. We're all very capable and coordinated.
Doesn't bother me if you enjoy stealing from the rich, and I'd be a hypocrite if it did. That said, I would be happier to hear about it if you only stole from assholes.
I haven't had a lot of time to sit back and admire art, but when I do get the chance I do enjoy going to a gallery, just a shame they're full of pricks. Maybe I should steal some for myself.
Well, sometimes I want to use that mystery to keep people at arm's length until I know them better. I've learned caution the hard way.
Sure, but I'm still working out if I can have one here with this table.
Well, you're not wrong. It doesn't seem like something you struggle with, though.
...Perhaps it is, would that be a problem?
It's lethal, but that's why I can't afford to lose my cool. It literally draws more Grimm when you panic and being unable to focus or react quickly is even more dangerous than they are.
I'll take the compliment, but trust me, Mary you do not want my romantic life... Well, not my past history at least...
Thanks... I didn't necessarily come here to get a date though. Besides, my relationships with anyone I meet here are less...complicated.
I'm not much for partying actually, but I appreciate the compliment. Are you more on the scene? I always admire people willing to put themselves out there.
If you consider me taking off my boots steamy. We have a very different set of kinks.
Always easier to spot a like-minded soul. Maybe we do have stories to share, I'd rather you went first though.
If I count as a woman with plenty of stories. I suspect your a library, and one I'd enjoy reading through.
Yes I would describe hunting the giant monsters that haunt our world as a serious job. You can quit, if you live long enough. Not sure I can recommend the job specifically to you, Yuno.

It's less about the content than being able to create distance when I want it, and deal with the slower parts of the game. It's an adventure novel my friend Ruby lent me. We exchange books. It's not my first choice but it's good.
Well I can hardly ignore that, what is it... Bobobo?
Do you always impose expectations on people you just met?

... I suppose so. I wonder sometimes if it even matters what I was born into. If I wasn't born where I was, surely it would have just been a different group of peers and adults pushing their ideals on me instead.
You too, it's always nice to... Sorry, what was that?
Thanks, it's not a uniform per say, but yes, I did design it for fighting, primarily. You're pretty stylish yourself.
That's probably a good move. I'm not against nicknames, though, if you get any actually good ideas.
It's natural to take a hit or two in a row. Typically I'd have a sense of your style and hit back by this point, but this isn't my typical battle ground.
Nothing odd about taking a few steps back before pushing forward again.
Okay, I thought I had a better idea of what I was doing than this. Maybe there is more strategy to this that I overlooked...
I feel like I've been caught in a damn thunderstorm at this point. Ah well, sometimes all you can do is try to enjoy the rain.
I don't make a habit of accusing people of rigging games, it's a serious accusation where I'm from, but I have to wonder...
I suppose I'll take the compliment, as indirect as it is, dealer. I won't leave, but if you rig the next game after I've already stripped in this one, I'll have more than harsh words for you.
Quite the time to have a string of bad luck, but I don't make a habit of starting what I won't finish, these days.
I'll have you know your spoiling my aesthetic.
Well, at least there was nothing more I could've done.
I'm playing a full game with you all. So you deserve something, I guess.
Since you're all staring anyway, I guess I can talk a bit about myself.
(It is nice to be getting attention for something I'm choosing to show off, for myself.)
Don't get too excited yet, but it's true I don't have much small stuff left.
Well, I don't want to lose the tights just yet, and you all seem alright, so...
(Deep breath, Blake, you can do this.)
It hardly matters compared to my ears... but even so, I'm hardly used to this.
I'm no stranger to scrutiny but this is... different.
I'd prefer it if you were looking forward to this, I suppose.
Not gonna try and pretend this isn't worth almost as much as my ears were.
I knew what I signed up for, but this is a lot.
I'm prepared to... finish the game, but I need a second to catch my breath.
<i> (Does losing oblige me to talk? I certainly didn't see that rule on the way in, at any rate.)
<i> (Would it be better to make meaningless chatter? I doubt it.)
It wouldn't feel right if I didn't take off a few things at least.
Sure, good luck never lasts forever anyway.
Well, no such thing as a totally clean win.
Life never seems to take me where I expect, but at least these days I'm more sure of my choices.
I've been in a lot of tougher spots than this.
You might have noticed by now, I'm not much of a party goer.
Can't say I mind too much... from either of you. I did know what I signed on for, even if I'm hardly used to it.
Umm, yes, I mean, well... it would be funny to watch him react, right?
Sacred? Not even our supremacists refer to us like that, but it feels a lot less... ugly, coming from you, Tao. Where I come from, Faunus is almost a dirty word. No tail though, sorry, Leon.
It's a good point, but I'd understand it better if you demonstrated, I think.
I'm not sure if you being so enthusiastic makes it better or worse...
Well done, Leon. You've thoroughly convinced me your eyes work.
I'm certainly happy to spar with you. You seem pretty handy with a weapon already though, or do you use your fists?
You do know what a nap is right? But no, unfortunately the clone is still, it takes a hit or two for me then vanishes. What do your Visions do? Does everyone who fights seriously have one?
Huh, okay that is a little unexpected. Maybe because you're not making agreements if you're forced into them? Or maybe he admires your dedication to your contract of knighthood as much as I do.

It's less exciting for us, they are constantly prowling the borders. Worse, they are drawn to negativity. The huntresses really only exist due to them, even if we fight people. But I'd be happy hunt with you.
That's quite a reaction to my cat ears, Noelle. I hope you don't mind me being a Faunus?
Faunus who assert themselves as better than others are almost as bad as the human racists... But, I can't deny that sounds tempting, and a little better. Should we... make a date of it?
You don't need to compliment me as a maid or whatever, but... no need to be shy. Sorry, I'm presuming, it's a good place to meet boys too, after all.
May I... return the favor? I'm also not sure how far I want to go here... but I find you... you are... it's... You're beautiful, and strong, with a heart to match.
Right, the book... I mean, uhh. It's just a simple adventure novel actually. No need to assume just because I brought it here.
That is quite simple for a school uniform. I assumed it was casual wear.
I'm not usually... the most cheerful on my team. Too much time in my own head maybe, but being here seems good so far.
I didn't come here with a clear plan on what I wanted, actually. I'm open to your suggestions though.
It might actually, and I'll accept it from you. I'm never at ease in new places, but I'm happy to have you here.
I do, no tail, do you have a problem with that, Leon? You wouldn't be the only one, I just hope for better.
I'll... keep that in mind, Leon. I didn't plan on it tonight, but you're... making a good case.
What exactly does that mean? I think just need some time, and get to know the crowd here, for better or worse. I'm open to your suggestions.
I understand, there is something familiar about you too.
And I... uhh. I like your hat, Sucrose.
You're very sweet Sucrose... I'd accept... either statement from you.

condition.saying: What sorts of monsters do you fight, then?

case.state: Grimm mainly. They are beasts drawn to negative emotion and constantly prowl our borders, expansion is difficult and maintaining borders is a struggle. We fight...people too, as needed.
I expect everyone I meet to be sunshine and roses, and I've never considered thinking before I open my mouth. How was my impression, Nadia?
If your whole mood is decided by the reservations of one person, how much fun are you at parties?
I do like fish Sushi, but there are... other places to eat it! Like the ones I went to you with! (Well this is going disastrously.)
Mostly... romance these days, but I'll branch out for a good book. The adventure books I used to read might be more your style, but these days I find the morality too simplistic.
... I apologize, Samus. I am pleasantly surprised to hear that. I kept these hidden for a reason, so I wasn't expecting anyone outing me to the table to be so agreeable.
You can say that again. Remnant is swarming with them. We're needed just to keep the borders secure.
Perhaps. Any idea what you'll find? Something tells me finding a few skeletons in the closet evokes a more cheerful reaction from you than most.
I get the feeling you get a kick out of people panicking, so I don't plan on losing my head, but I do want to know what the fuck that is.
Hmm, that's an interesting reply. Nothing jumps out at me that it'd feel right to ask for. Maybe a makeover at some point? I'm sure I could do worse than your guidance, and hands.
That person wouldn't happen to be you, would it, Lucy? I could care less, to tell the truth; I've got bigger problems than fake cat ears.
Yeah, as a huntress, my role is somewhere between monster hunter and peace keeper. I've dealt with plenty of dangerous people, most of them before I officially joined Beacon Academy. You?
I... yeah that's not far off. You certainly don't seem to mind.

It's actually very flattering and pleasant being the center of attention, for once... and, I didn't plan on anything like this but... I might be willing to be the center of attention for a bit... later.
You're so sweet Yang, for all your toughness... I... Of course I love you! And I'm really glad you brought this up first because I didn't know where we'd go after the final year.
It's just not my nature to lose my cool easily. My confidence and comfort are part of it, but I'm also confident that I don't need to take up space just because I could. Thank you though, Noire.

I'm confident in some ways, it's why I don't feel the need to talk too much too early, or pretend I feel totally comfortable and safe, when in reality I'm still getting used to the game. Thank you though, Noire.
Of Cat Noir, huh? I take it your magic comes with some kind of enhanced senses that make my bluffs useless then?
Yes, it certainly makes your appearance very clear, not that I mind much.
As huntresses, we train to hunt the creatures of Grimm. They are a constant threat to the people of Remnant. We also deal with... other threats. Nobody else seemed like they wanted to explain.
I'm a final year student training at Beacon academy with friends in team RWBY to become huntresses. I think you can figure out the rest, ~human~, given we're all... playing strip poker together.
I'm a final year student training at Beacon Academy with my friends in team RWBY to become huntresses. RWBY spells out our first initials. Ruby is team leader and admirably hopeful, no matter what.
I can share, I guess. I'm a final year student training at Beacon Academy with my team, RWBY, to become huntresses. RWBY spells out our first initials. Ruby's team leader. She's smart, and driven.
(... Maybe I should talk about where I'm from, or what I do, my friends, something like that... well, too late now. I only just met these people anyway.)
(I want to trust these people, and it seems like I can. Even so there aren't any guarantees, and I'm not in a hurry to appease them with small talk.)
Yeah, I'm a Faunus, that's what the cat ears mean on Remnant. It's not a big deal. I just prefer to avoid announcing it. Lots of people don't respond well to us.
My ears are why I wear the bow, but given how far this game goes, I guess I can show them. Acceptance of me and other Faunus is an issue back home, to put it mildly.
This is not where I pictured myself when I woke up this morning.
You can look, just... (Don't comment, please comment? I'm not sure.)
I'm not too nervous about this at least, it's pretty warm back home... though my other tops are more than just a bra.
(I do look good in these tights though, damn.)
I knew I'd end up showing off a bit. Not something I'm used to, but I'm not leaving now.
I got used to leggings when I was younger. Without them you get all scratched whenever you climb anything or need to run in a forest.
Sometimes the best way to climb a tree is to wrap your legs around it and haul yourself up, and trust me, doing that without tights is a mistake you only make once.
It's... It's alright, I knew what I was getting into and I still came. (Or more, I wouldn't mind that either even if I'm not going to admit that....)
I've dealt with worse than a simple game, even if this is... different. (And much hotter.)
In theory, taking these off is pretty much nothing... but I forgot the view you'll get of my tights. Ah well, not going to turn around now... and it feels nice to be admired from time to time.
There is a reason I wear shorts over these tights... but I don't back down from challenges, not anymore.

I'm a final year student training at Beacon academy with my friends in team RWBY to become monster hunters, more or less. That's not the most compelling story I could tell about myself, I know that...
I could tell you facts all day, I'm a student at beacon, I'm good friends with my team, I'm becoming a huntress, monster hunter and guardian. That's probably not what you most want to know...
Just as friends? I'm uhh... glad to be playing with you, you know. You look damn good too, after all.
Just as friends? I'm uhh... glad to be playing with you, you know. It's a shame we aren't... equally skilled at cards.
Is there a significant difference between being tied--- I mean yes, I… wait, never mind. I’m… comfortable, yeah. (And going to melt if these two keep it up.)
I've got more than one night free, Leon. And even if we do end up tangled, I don't think we want to exclude you, right, Tao?
I thought so, I do as well. I wasn't planning on admitting it yet but having other Faunus here is comforting... and having you here was already somewhat comforting.

Uhh---undead? Not outside of board games. Grimm are creatures of destruction, drawn to negative emotion. They physically appear like black and red eyed versions of natural creatures and vary a lot in size and power.
I'm certainly not arguing the point. Especially with men bold enough to buy us both drinks around, right?
I... umm... well. I... you can't assume what kind of novels I read. I'm not... against the idea though.
Uhh, thank you both. That's a far more positive response than I could have hoped for. I'm glad I came along... and I might do it again.
You're right, Sucrose. I'm always a little nervous too, but this is a good place. I suspected your ears from the start... and I think they are very cute.
I---I never said that either.

condition.saying: Some people change their behavior significantly depending on the situation they find themselves in, others act consistently everywhere.

case.state: I think it can be mark of strength to be consistent and honest with people, regardless of who they are.
You would be surprised about the fight utility... You aren't wrong about a game like this though. Thanks, I'm glad to be here.
Forgive me but, you hardly look the type. We might be a good match though. I mainly misdirect or dodge then strike with my Gambol Shroud, my uhh... Short sword, grappling hook, and gun.
Contracts and earth powers? That makes sense, they are both meant to be steady and reliable. I take it earning one isn't easy, more so so young?
Well, you know what they say about not looking a gift horse in the mouth too. I've got faith you were chosen for a good reason, and I don't even know these gods.
Thanks, Noelle. It's not every day I'm lucky enough to meet such an earnestly kind person as yourself. (This girl is impossibly adorable. I didn't think anyone could have Ruby or Pyrrha beat.)

I'll accept that response, we aren't so well received back home. With you here I thought maybe I'd be safe to. My love of tuna, and my tendency to follow pointers, and my fondness of small spaces aren't related.
Thank you... I'm not sure what I'm looking for beyond... some relaxation, but I'm glad I met you.
I've kept it in mind, promise.
Oh... well in that case... It's kind of cute seeing you blush, Leon.
I can see the appeal as well, Leon.
That's a terrible kitty joke, Leon. Luckily for you, I've gotten used to bad puns... and you're as handsome as you are sweet.
You too... I think we both know I won't win now. I'm... not so sad about that at this point though... Did you want a more private rematch? Maybe after a day walking the Liyue harbor together?

You'd think so. It's happened once or twice, but thinking on it, everyone is pretty strict about referring to us as 'Team RWBY'. It doesn't happen to every team, but it's more common than you'd think.
I don't get a lot of joy out of fighting for my life, but a hard day's work is satisfying, and it's not... morally complicated work. My team partner Yang gets a real kick out of it, at least.
You have racism enforced by purple robots? That's... unfortunate. I can accept being safe here, for tonight at least.
That's an interesting opener, Sucrose.
That's not true. Yours are very cute too, and I like that they are... canine.
I'd love to see them sometime then. If you didn't mind, Mari.
Thanks, Miku. You're probably too kind to me, but I'm glad to have you around.
Weiss is uhh... we get along better these days, she's strong and determined. Yang is... my partner, each person in the team has a partner, for attacks and stuff...
I'm sure I still could... if you wanted me to? (Fuck, why did I say that?)
Thank you, Mari. Despite how many times it's been good for me, I do tend to overlook or overthink the simple gestures.
Thank you, Mari. You're certainly off to a a good start with that.
Right, and it never occurs to you to switch that power off...? Then again, doesn't everyone want to be understood without needing to talk for hours?
...Capture Grimm? In balls? I can't imagine anyone even bothering. We've always just killed each other on sight.

Feel free to give it a go with your ball-tech, but they seem to run on hate and fear, so I doubt you'd get much use out of it. We train to hunt and kill them... though I have heard of captures at times.
Wow, Nanoko... There, did that satisfy you?
I don't plan on keeping to myself. I'm just not so desperate for company that I harass anyone who takes a moment to assess the situation
That's a damn good question, Ibuiki. I'd tell you not much beyond some physical quirks... but lots of people, on both sides, would disagree. Entirely due to entrenched bullshit.
Well, that's certainly easier in such good company. I'm looking forward to it.
I've always been perceptive, and I've learned to be thorough on the hunt.
Thank you, Nami. I really appreciate that, and that you clearly don't have a problem with them... I do enjoy having them petted, so, we'll see about that too.
I think everyone knows, they prowl at the edge of all our settlements . I've been learning how to survive them since I was a child, and now I can keep others safe.

Yang is... my closest friend, she's kind, gentle, and brave. Her and Ruby are good friends and teammates, better than I ever thought I'd have, or deserve. You can make your own judgments on Weiss though.
You're not so bad y-yourself, Leon. Not sure if they're worthy of that much praise, but I'm not complaining.
I know but life is... Complicated, you know that. I love the other two like sisters but I... Well, I'm more sure I can face the future if I know I can do it with you.
I don't have a particular love of puns, or cheese, but I've got a dear friend who makes up enough enthusiasm for them for both of us.
No. I don't 'chase balls of yarn', Nagatoro.<i> (Laser pointers are harder to ignore though...)
Weiss is, uhh. We get along better these days, She's strong and determined. Yang is... my closest friend. They're good friends, better than I ever thought I'd have. (Or deserve.)
It's hardly remarkable that I signed up for a strip poker game and undressed. I'm not expecting you all to look away like this was an accident.
(Yeah, It's a lot for strangers to just expect me to talk about myself. Next round I'll share something... probably.)
(If anyone was expecting me to be more talkative on my first loss, I guess they learned something important.)
Of course they match. I've been thinking about coming to this for... a while. (In both senses of the word.)
It's comfortable under the tights, alright? (Not saying that's the only reason I brought these ones, but it's true.)
The appreciation feels... a little unexpected, but I'm okay with it.
I have always been happy with my breasts; any bigger would make being so active frustrating.
(Deep breaths, Blake. You're having fun; you don't need to be nervous here.)
That's me. Sorry it's not more exciting, but I mostly like it.
I've got a friend who goes around with their shirt open, and Yang's always been a tease. I'm just more used to admiring than joining in.
It might seem a little early, but well... you'll probably understand soon.

Yes, I love fish, and climbing, and I don't like the dog... But that is coincidence, alright? (And I can't help but follow laser pointers, and I'm content in boxes, but they don't need to know everything.)
This is why I showed my bra first so... be nice, alright?
I didn't plan to dress to the item limit, but my outfit has a lot of layers. Sorry about that.
I don't wear anything too precious to me all the time---I might break or lose it.

...But I did just meet all of you. I signed up for this, but forgive me if I take a moment before I settle in. I've learned not to give out trust too easily, and I don't make a habit of losing my composure, that's all.
...And I'm happy to tell those stories, probably. This seems like a good space, but I did just meet most of you, and trusting isn't easy. I chose this, but I am still settling in.
I can't complain about you layering up. It's the smart thing to do. (Not that I did it on purpose.)
You're not anything new to me yet. It's hot back home, and I've got a friend who refuses to button his shirt.
I did come here for a good time, and you'd prefer me when I'm happy...
You don't want to be outdone by the quiet one, do you?
I could advise a better play, but then you might take it.
I don't miss... him, but sometimes I miss how safe I felt wrapped in his arms, dressed like this.
You can tell me how you... feel... about me right now. I knew what I signed up for.
It wouldn't be gentlemanly to leave me alone in my state, no?
What compliments do you enjoy? I'm not making any promises, but it'd be good to know.
( Two very attractive blondes back at beacon, come on. Give me a reason to think about you.)
If you're not interested in impressing me, you're making a mistake. (I'd let anyone touch my ears right now,especially if they teased my breasts at the same time.)
I've got nothing to worry about from you. I know that, sorry if I seem a bit... out of it at times.
It wasn't easy learning to get help from my friends, but I'd happily accept a helping hand right now.
I can hope you take off something worthwhile... but I'll be alright either way.
Honestly I can't remember the last time I stopped after just one round.
I'm still running hot... how are you feeling?
I do wonder how long my preference for romance novels will last. I liked adventure novels until it was stuff like that I needed the break from.
I'd hope for something good, but I've got enough real problems to hope about.
Not thrilled about meeting men for the first time in this context. Even if I'm not overly worried about them at Beacon.
Sure.
Not sure if I'm really in the mood to chat with you yet, but maybe you could impress me.
If you want my admiration, ~target~. Then play nice, insecure "tough" guys just make me roll my eyes.
I don't seem to be in danger here. Safe and bored may not be exciting, but it's good enough for me after everything.
It was bound to be somebody. You'll get a turn to watch eventually.
At least you're taking it relatively well. I was a little concerned.
I've nearly finished this chapter, hopefully in time to watch something nearly as good.
Don't feel obliged to hurry. I can always keep reading.
Feeling alright? I know this game can be a lot.
Sure.
Ruby gave it this book me when we last swapped, but it was one I loved when I was a little younger. It's nice to see it again.
Impressive slight of hand, I wonder if I could match that.
I am always interested in a good trick.
(I'm glad this game has slower rounds. Gives me time to get used to this place and these people.)
(She's pretty, but I'm not in a hurry to tell her that... not yet, anyway.)
I got lucky with people being nice to me at Beacon. I don't expect that to keep up.
I do appreciate wandering alone, it allows you to see the little beautiful things. Like leaves falling or dust settling, but I don't need any of that to admire you.
What you're taking off or not doesn't bother me too much. I'll just read for a bit.
Not expecting anything good, but I would appreciate it.
I'm reading so you don't feel pressured or anything. You can take your time.
Hmm.
This is an interesting phase of the game, removing something big isn't out of the picture, but it's not over yet.
Games are always more enjoyable when everyone involved actually respects the premise, you know.
You're not bad company, ~target~. I am happy to be playing along, even if I'm not as verbose as some people.
I have been looking forward to this more than the rest of the game.
I get playing to win, but don't you want to impress us?
I'm happy to be playing with other girls. You don't need to be shy.
In a way, maybe it's better there is only one winner. So those who need to... forfeit, have more company.
I don't hold it against you if you win and we don't see any more. Even if we all tried to throw, there would still be a winner.
Yang doesn't always have the easiest time convincing me to try new things. But knowing I'd be playing with people like you made coming here much easier.
Strangely I'm more comfortable now than when I started. Maybe you'd feel the same if you joined me?
I don't plan on doing anything more than just this game... but I'm pretty mercurial. I change my mind pretty easily when I have a good reason.
You're pretty enough as is, ~target~. You must know that, so it shouldn't come as any surprise I'm looking forward to this.
... So, are you playing to win? I am, but I'm starting see the appeal of losing. Do you want to help convince me, ~target~?
What do you like to hear? I might not be the most forward, but with a little guidance...
You've got my attention this round. Keep it please?
Shit that's good, I don't do this nearly enough.
I never said all my romance novels where about boys... Some of my favorite scenes are more like this...
I promise, your next move doesn't have to be as elaborate as anything I'm reading to get my attention.
I'll admit it... you could probably get me purring, but only if you try.
I've always been content with not rushing things, not wanting to get too close to people, but... do you want to join me, ~target~?
I really shouldn't be so hesitant about asking you for something good when I'm already doing... this.
Just a regular Friday night for us, huh, ~target~?
I'm doing this... for you, ~target~. For all of you, when you think about it. Will you reward me?
Do you want me to go another round, or not?
Planning to grab my attention? Or would you rather grab my wrists?
I can appreciate female and male beauty without making it sexual. However, being welcome to do so here is... very nice.
You're looking good, ~target~. I do think you'd look better in my current outfit though.
Do you play a lot of cards or have you been lucky? Or maybe whether your good at cards is a better question. I've played plenty and look at me.
Don't worry, ~target~. There's nothing to fear in this place, and even like this, I could protect us if there was.
It's even easier to appreciate build up when I'm also building back up, in my own way...
(Don't want to pressure her into taking off something big early, so I'll just read.)
(I'm not particularly worthy of her taking off anything notable, so I don't expect it.)
I do wonder a bit if this was the best use of my day. (The others made it very clear how important rest is. Relax, Blake.)
This is good, I could hardly bring... study material. So worst case at least I'm not fixating on that.
(That's not the chapter I planned to flip to... but I might just keep reading.)
(I do not know how I'm supposed to think straight right now. I might still be dressed, but I'm well... here... playing this.)
Can't recall a time I didn't need to work for anything worthwhile.
I would feel sorry for you if you had to take off anything big while I'm near fully dressed, ~target~.
Was this a worthwhile use of my time? I guess we'll find out by the end of the game.
I'm not going to sing your praises because you look good, ~target~. You'll need to give me something genuine to go off.
I'm not much for small talk, hard to tell, I know.
Huh. I wonder what the odds of that where.
I might be more comfortable with girls, but I'm glad your here, ~target~.
This is not what I mean by teasing me. Wait I---I only mean... forget it.
Forgive me for not being impressed.
I'd be disappointed but I'm still happy here.
Your ~clothing~? At this stage of the game? Well at least I brought books worth looking at... for reading I mean, of course.
(Hard to make judgments on how comfortable he'll end up yet, or how comfortable I should be.)
Well done on playing so well nobody is looking at you, even when you lose.
Cruelty being easy doesn't make it right, you know.
Whatever, I feel... somewhat satiated.
Sure, why not right?
It's certainly easy to appreciate your beauty, even if you're not... well, losing much.
I get it, you're really lucky, good for you.
Really? I've done nothing worth to being even slightly nicer to?
I'm still a bit hot... but this isn't helping.
I'd say your lucky I'm patient, but it turns out I'm a lot less patient when I've been all riled up.
(I wonder if I could be mad at Yang playing this well in a game like this... On second thoughts, I wonder if I could think at all if Yang joined me here.)
(The Ninjas Of Love author sure has a thing for girls leaving small items on. I didn't get it... until now.)
At least we're closer to something good. (Not really, I'm be better off thinking of Yang or Sun. laying my head on their chest... or chests, don't want to... leave anyone out.)
(Wow, that drives home how hard I lost. Then again, losing here and being unlucky might be different things.)
Well at least it's a kind of meanness that doesn't hurt anyone too much.
How did you manage that?
You're ~clothing~? When I'm done? I guess I have to be impressed.
Yang might crack a joke about removing minors here, if it hadn't happened to her more than once back then.
This is worse! At least accessories might mean something.
Sorry if I seem frustrated with you. (Because I am a little frustrated with you.)
Does being good at strip poker often actually come in handy?
You've taken some hits, but even so, if there is any skill in the game, you've clearly got it.
I don't mind the men taking it a bit slower. I'm still a little on edge.
It'll be something good next time right?
I guess even now a brief break from anything interesting is okay.
I can't be the only one in my year who reads smutty stuff like this, right?
Okay it's hitting a bit that I'm standing here naked when you take that off.
You're beautiful regardless, but that only made me hope for more.
C'mon don't keep teasing us, please.
Typical of my luck I guess.
Sure, why not ask right? Does that mean anything to you?
I'm a little surprised you're keeping my attention. You're pretty, but this is hardly new ground for either of us.
I can't be mad about that. (But I'm a little mad.)
The way this is playing out doesn't feature a lot in romance novels, I wonder why.
Thank you all... I didn't think I'd feel this comfortable with my ears out.
Guess I have got bigger fish to fry... I should really try to fry my own fish sometime, actually.
Not complaining about a win. (Or the view.)
Already? Well I wouldn't want you to be uncomfortable.
This is a little more than what I'm used to these days... but only a little.
I've put my book down. Well done.
As much as I might have an easier time playing around women, in a sense this is what I came here for.
Don't worry. Not everyone has the time to work out, and that's fine.
You can tell a lot about how active someone really is by their legs and arms.
It's been a while since I've been this happy about the unfamiliar.
If someone else called me a contented cat I'd probably tell them off... but it's a pretty good description.
Oh, just your ~clothing~? It's a good thing I'm as used to using my mind as I am my hands...
I'm still watching, but I can look away if you want.
I'm still paying attention... I mean, yeah, it's... never mind.
You caught my eye from the moment you walked in, ~target~, and it's only gotten harder to look away.
(Can't say I'm any more attracted now.)
Nothing to complain about from me.
I'm still pleasantly surprised I'm doing so well.
My immediate company tends to be female, not that I mind...
(I'm not about to pretend I don't like what I see, but I don't feel like commenting at this point.)
I won't stare, I'm better than that at this point. (Maybe just this point though.)
It's not much less than going to the beach, and I grew up on an island. You don't need to worry about me judging.
I can already tell a lot, and I like what I see.
I'll admit, I'm no stranger to this... and sex. I enjoyed myself at the time too, even if I'm glad that person is... gone now.
If you wanted, I could... tell you what I was just thinking, but I'm not going to do so uninvited.
You wouldn't want to keep me waiting too long, would you?

You remind me of... someone. (Of Sun, his winks do fluster me... sometimes. I'm glad he can't tell how I'm feeling, and that he doesn't notice when they do something... or maybe I'd prefer he did know...)
F-fuck, ~target~... Wait, I said that out loud, didn't I?
I am glad something is still happening. I don't want to go just yet.
Can I ask what you're taking off next? Sorry, probably shouldn't have said that.
It's nice to reassert myself. In spite of all his efforts, here I am, enjoying your company thoroughly.
(I could have helped her, but she's not in any real danger... and I do want to see this.)
It's certainly nice to see... nobody being judged for playing.
If only it was always so simple to get the upper hand.
This is rapidly getting beyond my normal comfort zone... but not beyond my... curiosity.
I don't think this is unfair at least.
I've read plenty of novels with this too. Not that it compares.
Competition is always most interesting when it's close, right?
It's not easy to just decide to set aside my concerns... but they're pretty easy to forget right now.
Have I met my match? Or has your luck taken an unusual downturn?
I'm not too invested don't worry, I'm just... reading... yeah. (Why am I a disaster?)
I'm not a natural flirt like Yang, but I need to say something about someone as pretty as you.
